attributes.action: Recognise In Law The British National Party As A Separate Ethnic Group
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
"The BNP is technically an ethnic group and, under Section 26 of the Race Relations Act, we would suggest there are grounds that an offence of incitement to commit racial harassment has been committed." - Simon Derby, BNP

The case of Mandla vs Lee (1983) defines ethnic groups under certain terms, several of which can be applied to the BNP. http://83.137.212.42/sitearchive/cre/legal/indirect/case_004mandla.html
The BNP's ancestors all have a shared geographical origin and must be of either Celtic, Anglo-Saxon or Norse origin, as described in the BNP's constitution.
"3) Membership of the party shall be open only to those who are 16 years of age or over and whose ethnic origin is listed within Sub-section 2." 
The BNP also has its own literature (The Patriot, The Rune and Spearhead), it's own common identity, has a common language and believes itself to be oppressed.
